A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Star Wars died when Luke milked the space cow. Then drank it... Or was it when he threw his lightsaber away for a cheap laugh? Actually maybe it was when Yoda turned up\, and burned the Jedi temple down. Hang on nah\, it was when Leia flew through space back to the ship. No but seriously\, it was when the female leader showed so much strength in not telling anyone what her actual plan was.....or was it when Chewy decided he was a vegetarian?  

Actually nope\, you want to know when Star Wars REALLY died? It was when Disney realised that the older loyal fans dont buy as many toys anymore. I mean sure\, they buy the odd Star Wars shirt and cup. But there is no money in that right? The real money is in the licensing\, merch\, big brands selling to parents of demanding kids. And in that moment\, the older loyal fans where ushered out of the gift shop by Disney. I mean\, there is no point making a billion dollars with a movie if you cant follow up with another billion in merch right?

If you dont think this is all about making money\, you are kidding yourself. 

Star Wars is dead. It died when that rich guy at the top decided he wanted a mansion with a better view.
